newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta stocks seen flat in slow trading.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta stocks seen flat in slow trading.

text.p: Jakarta stocks are seen remaining flat on Friday as sentiment will be cautious on the last day of the general election campaign, brokers said.
"Overall sentiment is likely to stay cautious as today is the last day of the campaign period," one broker said.
Brokers, however, said local players were seen active on selected small stocks for speculative reasons.
Another broker said small tourism services firm Bayu Buana was likely to be among the most active stocks due to market talk of a possible financial restructuring.
Sentiment on big-caps was likely to remain weak following Semen Gresik's announcement of poor first quarter net profit, brokers said.
On Wednesday, the Jakarta composite index rose 1.27 points to close at 654.09 points. The market was closed on Thursday for a public holiday.
